poem:
Beneath the Drone's Whir

Fires 

at Rostov,

oily, consuming—

Ukraine's reach,

a distant flame,

roiling.

From bright sky

the strike

veins 

through 

foreign

soil,

smoke 

like prayers,

rises,

silent.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war live: Ukrainian drone attack sparks fire at Rostov oil depot 11.04am BST Purported footage of the drone strike on an oil products reservoir in Kotelnich in Russia’s Kirov oblast – an attack being reported by Reuters and Russian media – shows flames and smoke in the aftermath of a hit. The moment of drone detonation in Kirov region of Russia.Russian Telegram channels reported that after the drone attack on the Zenit combine, a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
